intro: Lycianthes anomala, commonly known as the wild tomato or Mexican nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows as an annual shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are yellowish-green with five petals, and it produces small, round fruits that are often green when unripe and turn red when mature. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine.
